Returns: Current RTT audio mode. One of @B_android#telecom#Call#RttCall#RTT_MODE_FULL_E@, @B_android#telecom#Call#RttCall#RTT_MODE_VCO_E@, or @B_android#telecom#Call#RttCall#RTT_MODE_HCO_E@.
getRttAudioMode().Description: Returns the current RTT audio mode.

Parameters: int: The desired RTT audio mode, one of @B_android#telecom#Call#RttCall#RTT_MODE_FULL_E@, @B_android#telecom#Call#RttCall#RTT_MODE_VCO_E@, or @B_android#telecom#Call#RttCall#RTT_MODE_HCO_E@. Value is android.telecom.Call.RttCall.RTT_MODE_INVALID, @B_android#telecom#Call#RttCall#RTT_MODE_FULL_E@, @B_android#telecom#Call#RttCall#RTT_MODE_HCO_E@, or @B_android#telecom#Call#RttCall#RTT_MODE_VCO_E@
setRttMode(int).Description: Sets the RTT audio mode. The requested mode change will be communicated through @B_android#telecom#Call#Callback#onRttModeChanged_E@.

Returns: A string containing text sent by the remote user, or null if the conversation has been terminated or if there was an error while reading.
read().Description: Reads a string from the remote user, blocking if there is no data available. Returns null if the RTT conversation has been terminated and there is no further data to read. This method is not thread-safe -- calling it from multiple threads simultaneously may lead to interleaved text.

Returns: A string containing text entered by the user, or null if the user has not entered any new text yet.
readImmediately().Description: Non-blocking version of @B_android#telecom#Call#RttCall#read_E@. Returns null if there is nothing to be read.

write(java.lang.String).Description: Writes the string into the outgoing text stream for this RTT call. Since RTT transmits text in real-time, this method should be called once for each character the user enters into the device. This method is not thread-safe -- calling it from multiple threads simultaneously may lead to interleaved text.

ClassDesc: A class that holds the state that describes the state of the RTT channel to the remote party, if it is active.
